intro: Peschiera laevifructa, commonly known as the smooth-fruited pechiera, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves with smooth margins. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by smooth, spherical fruits. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
